newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: INP lifts stake in W&H to 77 pct.
newsitem.headline: INP lifts stake in W&H to 77 pct.

text.p: Independent Newspapers Plc said it had lifted its effective stake in New Zealand publisher Wilson and Horton to 77 percent at the close of trading on Friday from 74.87 percent.
Earlier on Friday in a substantial security notice, the company said it had lifted the stake to 74.87 from 72.9 percent.
INP subsidiary Independent Press Communications Ltd said it had raised its stake in W&H to 29.72 percent from 27.75 percent in its current takeover offer.
IPCL is bidding for all of Wilson and HOrton, offering NZ$11 or 1.375 exchangeable INP shares for each W&H share.
Independent Newspapers and family trusts linked to principal Tony O'Reilly held 45.15 percent of W&H prior to the bid.
